io.customerly

Class Customerly

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.customerly.Customerly

  • public class Customerly
extends java.lang.Object
    The singleton representing the Customerly SDK

    • Method Detail

      • with

        @Contract(value="!null -> !null; null -> _")
 @Nullable
public static Customerly with(@Nullable
                                                                                      android.content.Context pContext)
        Call this method to obtain the reference to the Customerly SDK
        Parameters:
        pContext - A Context. We strongly recommend to pass this parameter, even if it is optional, for stability reasons. Passing a context the return value will be surely not null. Besides, if not passed, due to some events in your application, the result can be null.
        Returns:
        The Customerly SDK instance reference

      • configure

        public static void configure(@NonNull
                             android.app.Application pApplication,
                             @NonNull
                             java.lang.String pCustomerlyAppID)
        Call this method to configure the SDK indicating the Customerly App ID before accessing it.
        Call this from your custom Application Application.onCreate()
        Parameters:
        pApplication - The application class reference
        pCustomerlyAppID - The Customerly App ID found in your Customerly console

      • configure

        public static void configure(@NonNull
                             android.app.Application pApplication,
                             @NonNull
                             java.lang.String pCustomerlyAppID,
                             int pWidgetColor)
        Call this method to configure the SDK indicating the Customerly App ID before accessing it.
        Call this from your custom Application Application.onCreate()

        You can choose to ignore the widget_color provided by the Customerly web console for the action bar styling in support activities and use an app-local widget_color instead.
        Parameters:
        pCustomerlyAppID - The Customerly App ID found in your Customerly console
        pWidgetColor - The custom widget_color. If Color.TRANSPARENT, it will be ignored

      • setVerboseLogging

        public void setVerboseLogging(boolean pVerboseLogging)
        Call this method to enable error logging in the Console. Avoid to enable it in release app versions, the suggestion is to pass your.application.package.BuildConfig.DEBUG as parameter
        Parameters:
        pVerboseLogging - true for enable logging, please pass your.application.package.BuildConfig.DEBUG

      • update

        public void update()

      • update

        public void update(@Nullable
                   Customerly.SuccessCallback pSuccessCallback,
                   @Nullable
                   Customerly.FailureCallback pFailureCallback)

      • registerUser

        public void registerUser(@NonNull
                         java.lang.String email,
                         @Nullable
                         java.lang.String user_id,
                         @Nullable
                         java.lang.String name)
        Call this method to link your app user to the Customerly session.

        You have to configure the Customerly SDK before using this method with configure(Application,String)
        Parameters:
        email - The mail address of the user, this is mandatory
        user_id - The optional user_id of the user, null otherwise
        name - The optional name of the user, null otherwise

      • registerUser

        public void registerUser(@NonNull
                         java.lang.String email,
                         @Nullable
                         java.lang.String user_id,
                         @Nullable
                         java.lang.String name,
                         @Nullable
                         Customerly.SuccessCallback pSuccessCallback,
                         @Nullable
                         Customerly.FailureCallback pFailureCallback)
        Call this method to link your app user to the Customerly session.

        You have to configure the Customerly SDK before using this method with configure(Application,String)
        Parameters:
        email - The mail address of the user, this is mandatory
        user_id - The optional user_id of the user, null otherwise
        name - The optional name of the user, null otherwise
        pSuccessCallback - To receive success async response
        pFailureCallback - To receive failure async response

      • registerUser

        public void registerUser(@NonNull
                         java.lang.String email,
                         @Nullable
                         java.lang.String user_id,
                         @Nullable
                         java.lang.String name,
                         @Nullable
                         org.json.JSONObject pAttributes,
                         @Nullable
                         Customerly.SuccessCallback pSuccessCallback,
                         @Nullable
                         Customerly.FailureCallback pFailureCallback)
        Call this method to link your app user to the Customerly session.

        You have to configure the Customerly SDK before using this method with configure(Application,String)
        Parameters:
        email - The mail address of the user, this is mandatory
        user_id - The optional user_id of the user, null otherwise
        name - The optional name of the user, null otherwise
        pAttributes - Optional attributes for the user in a single depth json (the root cannot contain other JSONObject or JSONArray)
        pSuccessCallback - To receive success async response
        pFailureCallback - To receive failure async response

      • setAttributes

        public void setAttributes(@Nullable
                          org.json.JSONObject pAttributes,
                          @Nullable
                          Customerly.SuccessCallback pSuccessCallback,
                          @Nullable
                          Customerly.FailureCallback pFailureCallback)
        Call this method to add new custom attributes to the user.

        You have to configure the Customerly SDK before using this method with configure(Application,String)
        Parameters:
        pAttributes - Optional attributes for the user in a single depth json (the root cannot contain other JSONObject or JSONArray)
        pSuccessCallback - To receive success async response
        pFailureCallback - To receive failure async response

      • openSupport

        public void openSupport(@NonNull
                        android.app.Activity activity)
        Call this method to open the Support Activity.

        You have to configure the Customerly SDK before using this method with configure(Application,String)
        Parameters:
        activity - The current activity

      • logoutUser

        public void logoutUser()
        Call this method to close the user's Customerly session.

        You have to configure the Customerly SDK before using this method with configure(Application,String)

      • trackEvent

        public void trackEvent(@NonNull
                       java.lang.String pEventName)
        Call this method to keep track of custom labelled events.

        You have to configure the Customerly SDK before using this method with configure(Application,String)
        Parameters:
        pEventName - The event custom label
